item.title: Comment on My Book Is Available (in England)! by hls88
item.dc:creator: hls88
item.description:
<strong>Good afternoon Cutie. I can</strong><br />Good afternoon Cutie.
I can not wait to get stuck into your book.
I read your article in Glamour magazine and on the Guardian website. For clumsy, hopeless romantic old fashioned girls like myself, your book is great value, common sense in an overly technical world with too many "do's & don'ts".
THANK YOU.
item.content:encoded:
Good afternoon Cutie.
I can
Good afternoon Cutie.

I can not wait to get stuck into your book.

I read your article in Glamour magazine and on the Guardian website. For clumsy, hopeless romantic old fashioned girls like myself, your book is great value, common sense in an overly technical world with too many “do’s & don’ts”.

THANK YOU.

item.title: Comment on My Book Is Available (in England)! by ElaineAsh
item.dc:creator: ElaineAsh
item.description:
<strong>This is thrilling news! How</strong><br />This is thrilling news! How wonderful for you, Cutie, and for your entire, loving family. Can't wait to see it here in America.
Elaine Ash
item.content:encoded:
This is thrilling news! How
This is thrilling news! How wonderful for you, Cutie, and for your entire, loving family. Can’t wait to see it here in America.

Elaine Ash

item.title: Comment on Book Review: How To Survive Anything – The Life Story of David and Yetta Kane by ElaineAsh
item.dc:creator: ElaineAsh
item.description: <strong>Cutie: This is so sweet of</strong><br />Cutie: This is so sweet of you to review HOW TO SURVIVE ANYTHING. I am David and Yetta's editor, and on their behalf, warmly thank you for the kind comments. More comments from us soon! Fondly, Elaine
item.content:encoded:
Cutie: This is so sweet of
Cutie: This is so sweet of you to review HOW TO SURVIVE ANYTHING. I am David and Yetta’s editor, and on their behalf, warmly thank you for the kind comments. More comments from us soon! Fondly, Elaine

item.title: Comment on M-M-Manischewitz by malmquiste
item.dc:creator: malmquiste
item.description: <strong>Elyse Malmquist Oh did I</strong><br />Elyse Malmquist Oh did I tell you that we are also Jewish and my mom's favorite wine is Manischevitz Concord Grape as is your's! As a child I grew up in the Jewish section of Fairfax District and Canter's was our hang out! Small world isn't it?
item.content:encoded:
Elyse Malmquist
Oh did I
Elyse Malmquist
Oh did I tell you that we are also Jewish and my mom’s favorite wine is Manischevitz Concord Grape as is your’s! As a child I grew up in the Jewish section of Fairfax District and Canter’s was our hang out! Small world isn’t it?

item.title: Comment on M-M-Manischewitz by malmquiste
item.dc:creator: malmquiste
item.description: <strong>Elyse Malmquist You remind</strong><br />Elyse Malmquist You remind me so much of my mother that it is unbelievable! I love you! Can I call you grandma? My mom was born 11/8/1917 is Chicago, IL and lived an exciting life in Hollywood, CA all the way to the San Fernando Valley (Encino) and then met her last husband in Oceanside where she was in a car accident in March 15, 2005. She passed away at Cedars Sinai Memorial Hospital, in L.A. and I really miss her! She would have loved you so much! God Bless you you sweet and beautiful woman! :)
item.content:encoded:
Elyse Malmquist
You remind
Elyse Malmquist
You remind me so much of my mother that it is unbelievable! I love you! Can I call you grandma? My mom was born 11/8/1917 is Chicago, IL and lived an exciting life in Hollywood, CA all the way to the San Fernando Valley (Encino) and then met her last husband in Oceanside where she was in a car accident in March 15, 2005. She passed away at Cedars Sinai Memorial Hospital, in L.A. and I really miss her! She would have loved you so much! God Bless you you sweet and beautiful woman! ðŸ™‚

item.title: Comment on Ask Grandma Anything: My mom has untreated schizophrenia by calnative
item.dc:creator: calnative
item.description: <strong>This is such a difficult</strong><br />This is such a difficult subject for those who know about it and for those who do not understand it. Schizophrenia is a disease, one that unfortunately for the one diagnosed with it, sometimes will not admit that they have, which makes it hard on the loved ones around trying to help. Cutie is right, the most important thing is to take care of yourself. It's difficult to be compassionate when the person does not want/cannot help themselves. I feel for you, my relationship with my Mother has deteriorated since she has become ill too. There is no right or wrong. Find the compassion at the little times you can but do not beat yourself up for things you cannot change.
item.content:encoded:
This is such a difficult
This is such a difficult subject for those who know about it and for those who do not understand it. Schizophrenia is a disease, one that unfortunately for the one diagnosed with it, sometimes will not admit that they have, which makes it hard on the loved ones around trying to help.
Cutie is right, the most important thing is to take care of yourself. It’s difficult to be compassionate when the person does not want/cannot help themselves. I feel for you, my relationship with my Mother has deteriorated since she has become ill too. There is no right or wrong. Find the compassion at the little times you can but do not beat yourself up for things you cannot change.

item.title: Comment on Cutie does Farmer’s Market by Ann Keeling
item.dc:creator: Ann Keeling
item.description:
<strong>Thank you for the</strong><br />Thank you for the opportunity to follow this spunky woman and her loving family. The love story with PopPop grabbed me. I can only imagine the long-term impact these memories will have on this family's lineage.
Ann Keeling Grandparent Gift Book
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for the
Thank you for the opportunity to follow this spunky woman and her loving family. The love story with PopPop grabbed me. I can only imagine the long-term impact these memories will have on this family’s lineage.

Ann Keeling
Grandparent Gift Book

item.title: Comment on Harry Cooper 1912-2010 by meowlam
item.dc:creator: meowlam
item.description:
<strong>Kim and family - Thank you</strong><br />Kim and family - Thank you for sharing your Poppop with the world. I'm so very very sorry for the pain that you are feeling now. I hope that the adventures of Cutie will continue to be documented here, as your grandparents have been a source of inspiration to so many.
With love from Long Beach, CA Lorrian I.
item.content:encoded:
Kim and family – Thank you
Kim and family – Thank you for sharing your Poppop with the world. I’m so very very sorry for the pain that you are feeling now. I hope that the adventures of Cutie will continue to be documented here, as your grandparents have been a source of inspiration to so many.

With love from Long Beach, CA
Lorrian I.

item.title: Comment on Cutie’s Cinema Corner: Inception by kim
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/08/04/cuties-cinema-corner-inception/#comment-581">kim</a>.
<strong>Good news! One of our nice</strong><br />Good news! One of our nice fans, Yael, volunteered to help transcribe some of the OGs videos for closed captioning, and the first one is now online at the link below. Just click the CC button under the video to activate the captions. We hope to get more online soon.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qy6R7-WhQ7M
item.content:encoded:
In reply to kim.

Good news! One of our nice
Good news! One of our nice fans, Yael, volunteered to help transcribe some of the OGs videos for closed captioning, and the first one is now online at the link below. Just click the CC button under the video to activate the captions. We hope to get more online soon.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qy6R7-WhQ7M
